intro: Lithocardium subcordatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing succulent with fleshy, narrow leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white during the summer months. It thrives in rocky soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Lithocardium subcordatum is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
